ygData.subject: Re: Playing Where's Waldo in Shar Vahl
ygData.msgSnippet: ... to ... hunt for ... able ... players ... Thanks. I found it. Unfortunately, I mistakenly thought that one of my Shaman spells was an offensive spell. It
ygData.messageBody:
--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Biltilie Dwimmerlaik"
<biltilie@m...> wrote:
> > now. How do I get into the crater and out of it without having
to
> > fall in and get killed to return tothe city? I'm starting my
hunt for
> > the three requested bare skinned rock hoppers.
>
> when you head from the city to Shadeweaver's, just when the bridge
> ends, turn to the right, but stay close to the wall. you should be
able
> to go up and down there.
>
> you should also memo the locations of guards in the crater, because
> you can train mobs on them; but be careful not to train on other
players
> resting there!
>
>
> - bilt
Thanks. I found it. Unfortunately, I mistakenly thought that one of
my Shaman spells was an offensive spell. It was something like Inner
Fire. It sounded like it would burn something when cast. I died
about 15 times before I finally figured out that something was
wrong. I cast the spell on myself and discovered that I was
increasing my hit points. I hope that the skelletons and the rock
hoppers appreciated me for being sporting enough to protect them
from damage while I was fighting them. ;)

Ok. I have a minor healing spell and a spell that raises hit points.
I have a shaman so I can't use my club. I tried to equip it with no
success. I have no money. No one wants to buy mushrooms (must be a
drug free town). I think that I need to somehow come up with some
money so that I can buy a scroll with a spell that can do damage. I
don't seem to be able to kill anything bare handed. I just keep
getting killed. Does anybody have any suggestions?

I could delete the character, start over, maybe sell one or both of
my spell scrolls and buy an attack spell scroll. But do I really
need to? Is there still hope for my character?
>
Edward
